resources.string: Allrecipe Killer App
IngredientSearch
Chicken Noodle Soup
Lentil Soup
Hot Artichoke Dip
Guacamole
Crispy Edamame
Grilled Chicken with Lemon
Spinach Enchiladas
Vegetable Lasagna
Penne Pasta Salad
Red Lentil Curry
Lemon Bars
Strawberry Shortcake
Chocolate Cupcakes
Chicken Noodle Soup is a trcfraditional soup using boiled chicken, pasta, carrots, peas and light herbs
Lentil Soup is made from a mixture of various lentils soaked in water overnight and boiled
Hot Artichoke Dip is a dip made using Spinach, Artichokes and cream. It is best eaten with chips
Guacamole is a traditional mexican dish made using Avocados, Tomatoes, Onions, Cilantro, and Lime. It is best eaten with chips but can also be eaten alongside various dishes
Crispy Edamame is a traditional Japanese Dish made using Edamame beans and is eaten as an appetizer
Grilled Chicken with Lemon is a entre made to taste using various herbs. It\'s strongest flavor is lime
If you like spinach and Mexican food, you\'ll love this dish.
Vegetable Lasagna is a pasta dish made with pasta layered on top of each other with marinara sauce and various ingredients in between
Penne Pasta Salad is a cold pasta dish made using various beans, penne pasta, and pesto sauce
Red Lentil Curry is a rich and hearty dish. Great as a main dish, but can also be eaten as a side dish. This dish is amazing with Basmati Rice
An intensly flavored layer of lemon custard, on top of a crisp, sweet shortbread crust makes these cookies almost like little slices of lemon pie.
Old fashioned Strawberry Shortcake dessert has tender homemade shortcake layered with sweet strawberries and fresh whipped cream
Ready in 30 minutes, this quick dessert is great for parties.

1 tablespoon butter, 1/2 cup diced carrot, 1/2 cup diced onion, 1/2 cup diced celery, 1 pinch salt, 1/4 teaspoon thyme leaves, 2 tablespoons melted chicken fat, 2 quarts roasted chicken broth, 4 ounces uncooked noodles, 1 pinch cayenne pepper, 1 pinch salt and ground pepper

1 chopped onion, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 diced carrots, 2 stlks of celery chopped, 2 minced cloves of garlic, 1 teaspoon of dried oregano, 1 bay leaf, 1 teaspoon of dried basil, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 2 cups dry lentils, 8 cups water, 1/2 cup sliced spinach, 2 tablespoons vinegar, salt, ground pepper

1 can artichoke hearts, 1/3 cup grated Romano cheese, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1/2 teaspoon minced garlic, 10 ounces of chopped spinach, 1/3 cup heavy cream, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 cup shredded mozarella
3 avocados peeled and mashed, 1 lime juiced, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup diced onion, 3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, 2 roma tomatoes diced, 1 pinch ground cayenne pepper
12 ounces shelled edamame, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, salt and pepper
1 3/4 cups Chicken Stock, 3 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon dried basil leaves, 1 teaspoon dried crushed thyme, 1/8 teaspoon ground pepper, 4 chicken breast halves skin removed

Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium heat. Stir in carrot, onion, celery, salt, and fresh thyme. Stir in chicken fat; cook and stir until the onions turn soft and translucent, 5 to 6 minutes. Stir in roasted chicken broth and bring to a boil. Season to taste with salt, if necessary; stir in noodles and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in cooked chicken breast meat and simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes. Season with cayenne pepper, salt and black pepper to taste.

In a large soup pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions, carrots, and celery; cook and stir until onion is tender. Stir in garlic, bay leaf, oregano, and basil; cook for 2 minutes. Stir in lentils, and add water and tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer for at least 1 hour. When ready to serve stir in spinach, and cook until it wilts. Stir in vinegar, and season to taste with salt and pepper, and more vinegar if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a blender or food processor, place artichoke hearts, Romano cheese, Parmesan cheese and garlic . Pulse until chopped, but not ground. Set aside. In a medium bowl, mix together spinach, heavy cream, sour cream and mozzarella cheese. Stir in artichoke mixture. Spoon into prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
In a medium bowl, mash together the avocados, lime juice, and salt. Mix in onion, cilantro, tomatoes, and garlic. Stir in cayenne pepper. Refrigerate 1 hour for best flavor, or serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the edamame into a colander and rinse under cold water to thaw. Drain. Spread the edamame beans into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle cheese over the top and season with salt and pepper. Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is crispy and golden, about 15 minutes.

Stir the stock, lemon juice, basil, thyme and black pepper in a small bowl. Lightly oil the grill rack and heat the grill to medium. Grill the chicken for 35 minutes or until it\'s cooked through, turning the chicken over halfway through cooking and brushing often with the stock mixture. Discard the remaining stock mixture.
Settings

string-array.name: Recipe1
string-array.item: Whisk rice vinegar, sugar, vegetable oil, ginger, and salt together in a bowl until sugar and salt are dissolved into a smooth dressing. Toss carrot, green onion, bell pepper, and cucumber in the dressing to evenly coat. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes.

string-array.name: Recipe2
string-array.item: Combine avocados and lemon juice in a large bowl; toss to coat. Add tomato, mozzarella, and basil; toss again. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt

string-array.name: Recipe3
string-array.item: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti at a boil until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 12 minutes; drain. Transfer spaghetti to a large bowl. Put cubed Romano cheese in the bowl of a food processor; process until coarsely grated, about 30 seconds. Put garlic into the food processor and process until the cheese and garlic are combined. Add spinach, basil, walnuts, lemon juice, lemon zest, and salt; process until the mixture comes together into a thick paste. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a spatula. With food processor running, drizzle olive oil into the mixture. Continue processing until the oil is integrated smoothly. Pour sauce over spaghetti and toss to coat

string-array.name: Recipe4
string-array.item: Thread each toothpick with: one tomato, 1/4 of a slice of prosciutto folded into a small square, one mozzarella ball, one basil leaf (folded if it is large), and one more tomato. Arrange appetizers on a serving platter. Drizzle with your favorite Italian salad dressing.

string-array.name: Recipe5
string-array.item: In a large pot with boiling salted water cook fettuccini pasta until al dente. Drain. Stir in pesto sauce and 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, saute onion and garlic in 3 tablespoons olive oil until soft. Add green bell pepper, mushrooms and cook until soft, about 3 minutes. Stir in dry white wine, lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste, and bring to a boil. Add scallops and toss for 2 minutes. Take care not to overcook the scallops, as they will toughen when exposed to prolonged heat. Toss the pesto covered pasta with the scallop sauce. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.
